One tourist dead, 12 rescued after boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach - The Indian Express
summary:
One tourist dead, 12 rescued after boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: Coastal Police

A tragic incident occurred at Calangute beach in North Goa, where a tourist boat capsized, resulting in one death and twelve rescues.

  • A 45-year-old tourist from Maharashtra, Suryakant Pophalkar, was declared dead.
  • The boat was carrying 11 family members from Ratnagiri district.
  • The incident happened around 12.30 pm when the boat was approximately 70 meters from the coastline.
  • Preliminary reports suggest a motor malfunction led to the capsizing.
  • All passengers were rescued and taken to a health center; six were referred for further observation.
  • There are ongoing investigations into potential negligence.
“According to preliminary information, the boat was about 70 metres from the coastline when its motor is alleged to have malfunctioned.” - Police Officer

This tragic event highlights the importance of safety measures in water sports, including weight limits and the provision of life jackets.
newTitle: Tragic Boat Capsize Off Goa's Calangute Beach Claims One Life

India poised to be malaria-free by 2030: Health ministry - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Poised to Achieve Malaria-Free Status by 2030

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

India has made significant progress in reducing malaria cases over the past 75 years, with a goal to become malaria-free by 2030, according to the Union health ministry.

  • The number of malaria cases has decreased from 75 million at independence to 2 million in 2023.
  • Annual malaria deaths have dropped from 800,000 to 83.
  • 122 districts reported no new malaria cases.
  • India exited the WHO's High Burden to High Impact group in 2024.
  • From 2015 to 2023, new malaria cases fell by 80%.
  • 24 states and UTs are in category 1, reporting less than 1 case per 1,000 population.
“India’s journey toward a malaria-free future is a story of remarkable transformation and progress.” - Union Health Ministry

In conclusion, the health ministry emphasizes that India's proactive public health strategies have been crucial in combating malaria, paving the way for potential elimination by 2030.
newTitle: India Poised to Achieve Malaria-Free Status by 2030

  • The stampede occurred during a large gathering for the film's release.
  • Producer Dil Raju emphasized the need for better safety measures in future events.
  • The meeting aims to ensure the welfare of attendees at public film events.
“We must prioritize the safety of our audiences during such significant events,” said Dil Raju.

This meeting is seen as a crucial step towards implementing necessary safety precautions in the film industry.

title: 'Free Imran Khan': PTI welcomes Trump's aide statement as PML-N calls for 'respecting sovereignty' - Geo News
summary:
Free Imran Khan: PTI welcomes Trump's aide statement as PML-N calls for 'respecting sovereignty'

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Geo TV

The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party has responded positively to Richard Grenell's statement advocating for the release of its leader, Imran Khan. The ruling Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) has, however, emphasized the need to respect national sovereignty.

  • PTI's Zartaj Gul, Aliya Hamza welcome Grenell's remarks.
  • PTI wants Imran's freedom in line with Constitution: Gohar.
  • PML-N's Talal rules out Imran's release on US pressure.

“Release Imran Khan,” Grenell tweeted, highlighting his long-standing relationship with the former prime minister during Trump's presidency.

“There are a lot of the same allegations just like President Trump, where the ruling party put him in prison and created some sort of corruption allegations and false allegations.”

The reaction from PML-N suggests a firm stance against any foreign pressure, emphasizing that Imran Khan's case is an internal matter.
newTitle: PTI Welcomes Trump's Aide Call for Imran Khan's Release Amidst PML-N's Call for Sovereignty

title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan, the CEO and MD of India Cements, has resigned along with other board members after UltraTech Cement's acquisition of a significant stake in the company.

  • N Srinivasan stepped down after UltraTech's 32% acquisition of India Cements.
  • UltraTech Cement acquired 10.13 crore equity shares of India Cements.
  • This acquisition results in India Cements becoming a subsidiary of UltraTech Cement.
  • Several other board members, including Rupa Gurunath and Chitra Srinivasan, also resigned.
“Srinivasan's resignation follows the completion of the acquisition and the cessation of control by the existing promoters.”

This change marks a significant shift in the leadership of India Cements following its acquisition by UltraTech, indicating a new direction for the company under its new ownership.
newTitle: N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal - Mint
summary:
N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan has resigned from his position as CEO and MD of India Cements following UltraTech Cement's acquisition of a 32 percent stake in the company, resulting in its classification as a subsidiary.

  • N Srinivasan and several board members stepped down after the acquisition.
  • The Competition Commission of India approved UltraTech's ₹7,000-crore deal for significant ownership of India Cements.
  • UltraTech now holds approximately 55.49% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • New directors have been appointed to the board post-resignation.
“UltraTech has acquired sole control of the company and has become the promoter.”

This acquisition marks a significant shift in the Indian cement industry, where consolidation and competition between major corporate groups are intensifying.
newTitle: N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO of India Cements Following UltraTech Acquisition

Baby John Opening Day Box Office Trends: Varun Dhawan starrer aims at a Rs 12 crore start - PINKVILLA
summary:
Baby John Opening Day Box Office Trends: Varun Dhawan starrer aims at a Rs 12 crore start

Published on Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

The Varun Dhawan led action entertainer, Baby John, has taken a promising start at the Indian box office, with early trends indicating a first-day business of Rs 11 crore to Rs 12 crore.

  • The film's performance benefited from the Christmas holiday but faced competition from other releases like Pushpa 2 and Mufasa.
  • It is suggested that without competition, Baby John could have opened in the range of Rs 13 crore to Rs 15 crore.
  • Despite the challenges, this is the best opening for Varun Dhawan among recent non-franchise films, barring 83 directed by Kabir Khan.
  • The holiday period ahead offers opportunities for Baby John to potentially achieve Rs 100 crore by the end of its run.
  • The first day's drop and subsequent hold in business on Day 2 and Day 3 will be crucial in determining its long-term trajectory.
“It’s a decent start for Baby John, but the trend over the next few days is crucial.”

In conclusion, while Baby John shows promise, its success will depend on audience turnout in the coming days amid ongoing competition.
newTitle: Baby John Aims for a Rs 12 Crore Opening Day at the Box Office

title: Mpox: Belgium Detects First Case Of Clade 1b Strain; WHO Tags It As 'Especially Concerning' - TheHealthSite
summary:
Mpox: Belgium Detects First Case Of Clade 1b Strain; WHO Tags It As 'Especially Concerning'

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: The Health Site

Mpox continues to be a global concern with Belgium reporting its first case of the Clade 1b strain, marking it as the eighth non-African country to do so. The WHO has noted the rapid spread linked to sexual contact.

  • Belgium reports first case of Clade 1b strain of mpox.
  • The strain is spreading faster through sexual contact, not animal to human transmission.
  • Other detected countries include Canada, Germany, Sweden, Thailand, the UK, and the US.
  • Initially emerged in the DRC, now spreading among young adults and potentially children.
“It is spreading among young adults via close physical contact, often sexual contact,” WHO stated.

While mpox can be transmitted from animals, recent outbreaks suggest human-to-human contact is a major factor in its spread, particularly through sexual activities.
newTitle: Mpox: Belgium Detects First Case Of Clade 1b Strain; WHO Tags It As 'Especially Concerning'

title: Amid PM Modi outreach to Church, a look at Sangh Parivar’s fraught ties with Christians - The Indian Express
summary:
PM Modi's Outreach to Christian Community Amid Tensions with Sangh Parivar

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent address to the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India marks a significant outreach towards the Christian community, as he condemns past attacks and aligns his slogans with Christian teachings. This move is part of a broader strategy by the BJP to engage with states having substantial Christian populations.

  • Modi addressed the CBCI at a Christmas celebration, marking it as a historic outreach.
  • He condemned the Christmas market attack in Germany and the Easter bombings in Sri Lanka.
  • Modi aligned his slogan “Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas” with the values of mercy and service depicted in the Bible.
  • Despite this outreach, tensions between the Sangh Parivar and Christians persist, especially around conversion issues.
  • The BJP aims to strengthen its position in states with significant Christian populations, notably the North-east and Goa.
“The Bible says, carry each other’s burdens. Jesus Christ has shown the world the example of mercy and unconditional service.” - PM Narendra Modi

Modi's outreach is seen as a strategic move to build connections with the Christian community amidst historical tensions driven by the RSS's stance on conversions.
newTitle: PM Modi's Outreach to Christian Community Amid Tensions with Sangh Parivar

title: OnePlus Nord Buds 3 review: ANC meets bass on budget - IBTimes India
summary:
OnePlus Nord Buds 3 review: ANC meets bass on budget

Publication Date: September 17

Source: International Business Times

The OnePlus Nord Buds 3, launched on September 17, have made a significant mark in the budget TWS market by offering good performance for casual users who prioritize battery life and comfort over high-end audio quality.

  • Minimalist design with IP55 rating for water and dust resistance.
  • Lightweight at just 4.4 grams per earbud, ensuring comfort during extended use.
  • Powered by 12.4mm titanium-coated drivers for balanced audio with punchy bass.
  • Effective Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) for blocking low-frequency noise.
  • Impressive battery life offering 7 hours on a single charge and 36 hours with the case.
  • Fast charging capability providing 5 hours of playback with just 10 minutes of charge.
“For those willing to spend more, the Nord Buds 3 Pro offers an upgraded experience at ₹3,299.”

In conclusion, the OnePlus Nord Buds 3 presents a compelling option for budget-conscious consumers, balancing features and affordability, although it has some limitations like the absence of multipoint connectivity and high-resolution audio codecs.
newTitle: OnePlus Nord Buds 3 Review: Affordable ANC with Impressive Bass
